symptoms.name: Pain
symptoms.pattern: May be absent or present, depending on the size and location of the tumor and involvement of adjacent structures.

symptoms.name: Abdominal mass
symptoms.pattern: May be palpable or detected on imaging.

symptoms.name: Weight loss
symptoms.pattern: May be significant in advanced stages.

symptoms.name: Fatigue
symptoms.pattern: May be present due to the disease process.

symptoms.name: Nausea/vomiting
symptoms.pattern: May be present if the tumor obstructs the gastrointestinal tract.

symptoms.name: Constipation or bowel obstruction
symptoms.pattern: May be present if the tumor compresses the intestines.

vital_signs.heart_rate: May be elevated in advanced stages due to anemia or other complications.
vital_signs.blood_pressure: May be elevated due to tumor compression of blood vessels or other complications.
vital_signs.respiratory_rate: May be elevated due to tumor compression of the lungs or other complications.

lab_values.Complete blood count (CBC): May show anemia, leukocytosis, or thrombocytopenia.
lab_values.Liver function tests (LFTs): May be abnormal if the liver is involved.

imaging_findings.CT scan: Shows the location, size, and extent of the tumor; may reveal lymph node involvement or distant metastases.
imaging_findings.MRI: Provides detailed images of soft tissues, helpful in assessing tumor characteristics and involvement of adjacent structures.
imaging_findings.Ultrasound: May be used to guide biopsies or other procedures.
imaging_findings.PET scan: May be used to detect metastatic disease.

required: Imaging evidence of a retroperitoneal mass
supportive: Clinical symptoms suggestive of retroperitoneal malignancy
